articles.title: Classrooms First: Stop the Consultants, Fund Teachers & Core Curriculum
articles.summary: Orange USD's budget should prioritize direct classroom spending—teachers, textbooks, and materials—not administrative overhead and outside consultants.

articles.title: A Parent's Guide to Your Rights in Orange Schools
articles.summary: Know your rights as a parent in the Orange school system. From curriculum access to board meeting participation, here's what you need to know.
articles.body:

articles.title: Restoring Order: Clear Rules, Real Consequences, Safe Campuses
articles.summary: Orange schools need consistent discipline policies that protect learning time for all students. Here's what that looks like.
articles.body:
## The Problem is Clear

**Teachers can't teach when classrooms are chaotic.**  
**Students can't learn when they don't feel safe.**  
**Parents can't trust schools that won't enforce basic rules.**

Orange schools need a return to **clear expectations, consistent enforcement, and real consequences** for behavior that disrupts learning or threatens safety.

This isn't about being "tough"—it's about being **fair.**

articles.title: Parents Deserve a Weekly Window Into Classrooms—Here's the Plan
articles.summary: Simple, consistent communication about what's happening in Orange classrooms each week—it's time to bring parents into the loop.
articles.body:
## The Simple Ask

Every Friday afternoon, parents should receive a brief email or portal update showing:

- **This week's lessons** in core subjects (what was taught, not just topics)
- **Next week's preview** so parents can prepare conversations at home
- **Any changes** to curriculum materials or teaching methods
- **Resources** parents can use to support learning at home
